_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Introduction



Hawkins, Inc. is a progressive concern supplying chemicals, delivery systems and expertise to improve the environment, create alternative solutions for delivery and assist customers in creating new offerings across many markets. Our primary focus has traditionally been on the sale, delivery and safe handling of bulk chemicals. Today, the Company is becoming more specialized by working with customers with very exacting specifications seeking appropriate and innovative alternatives to meet their respective needs.



The Water Treatment Group provides water and waste-water treatment equipment and chemicals to improve the quality of life and operate in concert with the environment.



Hawkins also serves customers on a relatively regional basis in the Industrial sector in the fields of energy, electronics, chemical processing, pulp and paper, medical devices and plating.  Food manufacturers and processing plants as well as pharmaceutical concerns across the nation benefit from Hawkins' chemical distribution, blending and related expertise. 



Hawkins' mission is to exceed our customers' expectations as a high-quality, service-oriented chemical supplier. We adapt quickly to the changing chemical needs of customers with a keen focus on technical expertise, teamwork, safety, profitability, and responsible care of the environment and of our community.



Executive Summary



Hawkins' management has set a goal of 'zero accidents' which includes both injuries and environmental releases.  Support for this goal is manifested in a number of ways such as:



?    A corporate Health, Safety and Environmental department staffed with trained professionals.

?    Training programs in chemical safety, accident prevention and emergency response.

?    Prompt investigation of near misses and incidents to identify root causes and implement measures to prevent

          future occurrences.

?    Adherence to all OSHA regulations governing our operations.

?    Compliance with DOT requi

rements regarding shipping of materials.

?    Audits of safety procedures at all Hawkins locations.



This facility is a chemical distribution warehouse that handles a number of materials used to protect public health by treating water, wastewater, swimming pools, and other uses.  Hawkins supplies bleach used in disinfection at food processors and health facilities.  Among our chemicals is chlorine which is regulated by RMP.  Billings also stores sulfur dioxide, but our inventory is below the RMP regulatory threshold.



Accident prevention is achieved through handling procedures that properly protect cylinders during shipping, storage and use.  This starts with DOT approved cylinders that are robustly designed to contain chemicals through all conditions expected during processing, as well as mishandling that could cause a cylinder to fall or shift during transport.  It continues through having employees trained in proper handling procedures, and they are provided with equipment to safely move chemicals during storage and transportation.  Adherence to OSHA workplace rules is just another part of our safety program.



We also follow industry standards, such as those of the Chlorine Institute, to ensure that our equipment and procedures are protective of the health and safety of our employees, neighbors, and the environment.



As a result of our diligence, there has not been an accident involving chlorine at this facility within the last five years, nor has there ever been any such accident since the start-up of operations here.



In the event of a minor leak, employees are trained how to detect the source and take appropriate action such as tightening a valve.  If a larger accident should occur, Hawkins employees are trained to call in the local fire department that is familiar with our operations.  We have on site a special recovery vessel into which a leaking container can be inserted to contain further release from a cylinder.



While Hawkins desires to continu
ally improve safety, there are no specific changes planned other than continued compliance to industry standards and government regulations.
